Description:
ROOM FOR A CARAVAN OR BOAT
With interest rates at a record low, now is the time to invest in your future...
Showcasing flawless contemporary style, this recently completed north-facing, two-storey townhouse could be the new home you've been searching for. Whether you're on the hunt for a quality investment or an on-trend abode you'll be proud to own, it won't disappoint.
The boutique complex of six residences with minimal connectivity fosters a sense of community while maintaining seclusion and privacy.
Your new home features ground-level main bedroom with walk-in-robe and ensuite, separate powder room, big combined living, dining and kitchen area opening to a private courtyard with covered alfresco for entertaining or simply relaxing in style.
Whip up gourmet delights in the customised modern kitchen boasting stylish European designed gas/electric cooking appliances, dishwasher and high-gloss cabinetry including a 4-metre stone-topped peninsula bench with a waterfall end and chic pendant lighting overhead.
Upstairs is perfect for older children or guests with an additional living room, two generous bedrooms with robes, separate bathroom and another powder room
Added features include European laundry, large under-stair storage room/study nook, split-system air-conditioning, neutral décor and two-car remote garage with internal access, storage space and personal door to the fully-fenced rear yard.
Oozing superior quality and designed to embrace easy living, this is an ideal opportunity for those looking for a home in a convenient location where you can walk to the hospital precinct, Lake Weeroona, local eateries, public transport, sporting facilities and the CBD.
Insights: 3/17 Bakewell Street, North Bendigo VIC 3550 was last sold in 2020 and 69 other 3 bedroom house in North Bendigo have recently been sold.

Description:
Pioneer Rise Estate - Strathfieldsaye's newly released final Stage 2 (15 Lots)
- Outstanding building block of 703m2 in great location
- Stage 2 (Final) only 15 blocks available. Stage 1 sold out very quickly.
- Strathfieldsaye's newly released sub-division offers all services and has a lovely rural outlook
- Level 1 filled areas - filling if any is compacted to achieve a similar or better density than natural ground, so no significant cost to build on the level 1 filled areas
- Pioneer Rise Estate is serviced by underground electricity, natural gas, town water, NBN ready, planning permits to build are also in place for each dwelling. All you require is your building permit
- Growing suburb of Strathfieldsaye, fabulous community with all amenities
- Location is on the corner of Ryalls Lane and Guys Hill Road, Strathfieldsaye
- Demand will be significant so call Gavin to secure a block of choice.
- BAL rating is 12.5 for Lots 27, 28, 29, 30, 31, 32, and 35 to 41. Lots 33 and 34 are a BAL rating 29.
- Information booklet on www.pioneerrise.com.au
This fabulous new sub-division only just now released offers families an opportunity to buy a lovely block in the fast growing suburb of Strathfieldsaye. A great family community where people enjoy living and take advantage all that Strathfieldsaye has to offer as well as being only minutes to the Bendigo CBD.
Note: The Status report online shows blocks as available. You need to call Gavin on 0427 887 766 to ask which blocks remain available.
This information has been provided to us by third parties and we do not accept any responsibility for its accuracy. You should make your own enquiries and check the information so as to determine whether or not this information is in fact accurate. You must make your own assessment and obtain professional advice if necessary.

Description:
7 acre Lifestyle Property - Strathfieldsaye
Welcome to 63 Sinclairs Road Strathfieldsaye
This glorious lifestyle property offers seven acres (3.04ha) of picturesque privacy and a sprawling family-friendly fully renovated home within easy reach of Strathfieldsaye schools, shops, and the centre of Bendigo.
Perched on one of Strathfieldsayes most elevated positions the home showcases stunning views of Mt Alexander from multiple indoor and outdoor vantage points.
Any avid cook will be drawn to the large upgraded kitchen with Miele and Bosch appliances, LED lighting and sweeping stone benchtops centrally positioned in the spacious open plan design to provide easy serviceability to the lounge, meals area, breakfast bar, family/living room, sunroom, veranda/alfresco patio or expansive covered outdoor entertaining/fernery area.
The home provides 4 bedrooms, comprising a master suite boasting a walk-in robe and an updated ensuite and a separated kids zone with three double bedrooms each offering built-in robes, ceiling fans and easy access to the updated main bathroom and laundry.
Completing the homes internal design is a must have in 2020, a gym /home office with internal and external entrance that provides separation from the main living areas of the home for anyone trying to balance a work from home and family lifestyle
Additional property features:
Recently repainted interior and exterior.
Ducted gas heating, split system air-conditioning feature gas heater and wood heater.
Quality floor coverings and blinds
11x7.5-metre three-car powered carport with a concrete floor along with additional space for a caravan, boat, or trailer.
Multiple water supply options, town water, 23000 litre water tank and large dam with pressure pump for inground watering system
Convenience of natural gas supply
Energy cost savers, R3.5 insulation batts, Draft stopper units fitted to all exhaust fans and Spinaway ceiling cavity ventilation units.
Rabbit-proof fencing surrounding the approx. 4 acre house paddock
Security of a solar electric driveway gate.
Nearby "off main road" bike tracks provide connection to Strathfieldsaye primary schools, shops, and Catherine McAuley College.
Insights: 63 Sinclairs Road, Strathfieldsaye VIC 3551 was last sold in 2012.

Description:
QUIET AND PEACEFUL PLEASER
Retreat to quiet and comfort in this position perfect abode.
Leave the car at home and take a 10-minute walk to the nearby supermarket and shops or enjoy the fresh air strolling around Kennington Reservoir this comfortable home allows you true ease of living.
Set on 700m2 and nestled in a quiet and beautiful nook of Kennington, this well-kept neat and tidy three-bedroom two-bathroom home also offers a single car lock-up carport with additional with direct access to the secure backyard boasting your large undercover entertaining patio.
Inside, you're greeted by your light and bright open plan living space at the front of the home which flows into the dining area and spacious kitchen.
Whip up a meal with ease in your fully equipped kitchen complete with all the essentials and walk-in pantry and easily maintain the home's climate all year round with gas ducted heating and split system cooling.
Stepping outside through the glass sliding doors create your own tranquil area to enjoy your morning coffee and soak up the sun in the fully secure and part-paved backyard complete with large garden shed, water tank, pergola and established gardens.
Master with ensuite, two spacious bedrooms one with shade awning - and large laundry with outside access make up this rest of this home.
Invest and bring in a rental income or settle in and make it your ideal comfortable home.
Within walking distance to some of Bendigo's most popular schools and university, this property in a sought-after street is a must to inspect.
Contact agent Shelby Healey.
Insights: 3 Barwon Drive, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2020 and 74 other 3 bedroom house in Kennington have recently been sold.

Description:
CLASSY STRATHDALE HOME, YOUR OWN SLICE OF HOLLYWOOD WITH A 973m2 GARDEN!
Superb spaces, a low traffic location, and a neighbourhood rich with family-focused amenities it's all here at 8 Hollywood Crt, Strathdale!
Perfect to welcome your family straight away, and offering scope to further update to your tastes when budget and time allow, this warm, and inviting sanctuary is just moments from the bus, a short walk to primary and secondary schools and an easy stroll to Strathvillage and its dining options, cafes, supermarkets and of course the hotel. Buyers at every stage will see the appeal of this popular pocket.
The spacious, perfectly presented floorplan comprises a formal lounge and dining enhanced new carpet, a generous family-meals over-looked by a renovated kitchen, and large master with ensuite and walk-in robe plus three bedrooms served by the sizable family bathroom. Light, bright and updated to meet the needs of the family, it includes.
For those looking to settle into this highly sought, tightly held address in a walk-to-anywhere location, this really is a brilliant buying opportunity.
Internal area
180m²

Description:
Boulevard of Dreams.
Follow your dreams to this family home in a prized Strathfieldsaye position.
The modern façade and easy-care front landscaping are just the beginning. Step inside where ducted heating and cooling flow through the three bedrooms and study (or fourth bedroom), two bathrooms, a large lounge and roomy open-plan kitchen/meals and family area all bathed in natural light courtesy of picture windows overlooking the private side garden.
The approximately 665m² low-maintenance block includes a double auto garage with roller door to the secure back yard, a covered and paved outdoor living area, garden shed, rainwater tank, gated side access for a caravan, trailer etc. and off-street parking.
It's ideally located opposite a treed reserve and close to a bus stop and Battunga Park Playground with Strathfieldsaye schools, shops and recreation facilities easily accessed by bitumen walking tracks.
It's perfect for the first home buyer looking to enjoy the freedom of owning your own home. Or for investors, the home is currently leased to fantastic tenants who treat the property as their own and would welcome a new landlord (current rent $410 per week).
** COVID 19 **
This property is available to inspect by appointment only. To arrange your private viewing please contact the agent or our office on 03 5444 2526.
While attending an inspection, we request that all attendees show their ID and provide contact details before entering the property.
Insights: 55 Brentwood Boulevard, Strathfieldsaye VIC 3551 was last sold in 2015 and 29 other 3 bedroom house in Strathfieldsaye have recently been sold.

Description:
Easy to live in easy to let out
It's the small things that matter in life, like this compact unit offering a simple solution for an uncomplicated lifestyle.
The central unit in a complex of three features two bedrooms with built-in robes, spacious living room with split system air conditioning, light-filled kitchen with gas/electric cooking appliances, double pantry and island breakfast bar separating it from the ample meals area. A modern three-piece bathroom, separate WC and Euro-style laundry tucked away out of sight complete the residence.
Outside features include single garage with direct internal access, covered alfresco area and a compact, private rear yard.
The neat little package is the perfect place for starters or savvy investors. In near-new condition, there's nothing further to spend with a great tenant already in place who would love to stay on (current rental $260 per week).
Don't miss this chance to secure your future.

Description:
UNIQUE FAMILY HOME IN CENTRAL FLORA HILL
A unique treasure in a highly sought after suburb of Bendigo, this special family home has a lot to offer.
Warm and inviting, the provincial-style kitchen features oodles of bench space with a timber-top breakfast bar and stainless steel appliances including Smeg oven and gas hotplates. The kitchen overlooks the open living and dining area drenched in natural light from plantation shutters throughout and a large Velux skylight with electric blinds.
The second living area features a built-in console cabinet and is wired with surround sound. Three great-sized bedrooms with built-in robes, the large master suite with ensuite. With it's own external entrance, the property also boasts a multi-purpose home office or third living area with front access ideal for those working or running a business from home.
Outside boasts a huge 7.9m x 4m merbau deck ideal for entertaining, a 7m x 3m workshop and water tank.
Other features include a large laundry/utility room offering plenty of storage, dual driveways, polished timber floorboards throughout, ducted heating, evaporative cooling and blockout blinds.
Located in popular Flora Hill, this beautiful home is a rare gem boasting an abundance of living space with the convenience of proximity to schools, shops, public transport, sporting venues, the university and CBD. This property is a must to inspect.
Insights: 2 Leonard Avenue, Flora Hill VIC 3550 was last sold in 2020 and 47 other 3 bedroom house in Flora Hill have recently been sold.

Description:
AFFORDABLE WITH EXTRA YARD SPACE
Situated in popular Mafeking Street South is this lovely unit tucked away at the end of a five-unit complex. It is peaceful and private and you have approximately 300m2 of land offering a little extra room for a veggie garden, grassed area or maybe a shed STCA.
The unit is mostly original and boasts two bedrooms with built-in-robes to both; there's the bathroom with it's separate bath, shower and vanity basin; separate laundry with storage and a separate toilet.
Spacious carpeted lounge with updated gas wall furnace and box air conditioner and the adjacent meals space is large enough for a six-seat table. The kitchen is quite large for a unit and was updated a little in the early 2000's with stainless electric oven, gas hot plates, overhead cupboards and a double sink.
Outside is the spacious side yard, the single carport and garden shed, gas hot water unit, water tank and sunblinds on the front windows.
This is a wonderful little unit in an even better location offering great investment scope or for an owner occupier wanting to live in a lovely quiet unit complex with fantastic neighbours.
Insights: 4/40 Mafeking Street South, Kennington VIC 3550 was last sold in 2020 and 21 other 2 bedroom unit in Kennington have recently been sold.

Three great sized bedrooms, main with walk in robe and ensuite with built in robes in the remaining two bedrooms

Description:
Capital Idea!
You'll have noticed that the current Bendigo property market is competitive. I think this competition is creating an increasing awareness of the economics of real estate. When the demand for property is greater than the supply of property we must be quick to recognise value and quick to act to secure it. Many buyers are naming three main common criteria in their search for value, being: location, lifestyle and the prospect of capital growth. Smart!
In considering location there's an increasing awareness that well established neighbourhoods in popular suburbs represent great value. Strathdale has long been regarded as a most appealing location. The suburb has beautiful streetscapes, quality constructions and a variety of housing styles and thoughtful designs. Strathdale is also prized for its picturesque natural surrounds and access to popular amenities.
It's these natural surrounds and popular amenities that elevate the lifestyle benefits of this property. Nabilla Crescent is positioned opposite Kennington Reservoir, and walking distance to Strathdale Park. As well as Kennington Village, Strath Village and Strath Hill. The nearby Harley Street Cafe and Edwards Providore are two very popular destinations for those who have just enjoyed a shop, a visit to a nearby gym or pool, time at a playground with the kids or grandkids or a walk around the Reservoir with friends.
This top location and these highly sought after lifestyle benefits are likely strong indicators of the prospect of future capital growth. As are the traits of the property itself. There's an increasing appetite in the market for four bedroom, two bathroom homes. This residence offers four robed bedrooms and three bathrooms. You'll notice that the family room has a bathroom and is in addition to a living room, formal dining and lounge. This opens up the option of a fifth bedroom and the opportunity to capitalise on the rental return of a five bedroom home. The property has great access to public transport, schools and La Trobe University.
If location, lifestyle and the prospect of future capital growth are also your main criteria, you'll surely agree that 22 Nabilla Crescent offers great value. Securing it is a capital idea!
Insights: 22 Nabilla Crescent, Strathdale VIC 3550 was last sold in 2020 and 46 other 4 bedroom house in Strathdale have recently been sold.

Description:
Pioneer Rise Estate - Strathfieldsaye's newly released final Stage 2 (15 Lots)
- Outstanding building block of 700m2 in great location
- Stage 2 (Final) only 15 blocks available. Stage 1 sold out very quickly.
- Strathfieldsaye's newly released sub-division offers all services and has a lovely rural outlook
- Level 1 filled areas - filling if any is compacted to achieve a similar or better density than natural ground, so no significant cost to build on the level 1 filled areas
- Pioneer Rise Estate is serviced by underground electricity, natural gas, town water, NBN ready, planning permits to build are also in place for each dwelling. All you require is your building permit
- Growing suburb of Strathfieldsaye, fabulous community with all amenities
- Location is on the corner of Ryalls Lane and Guys Hill Road, Strathfieldsaye
- Demand will be significant so call Gavin to secure a block of choice.
- BAL rating is 12.5 for Lots 27, 28, 29, 30, 31, 32, and 35 to 41. Lots 33 and 34 are a BAL rating 29.
- Information booklet on www.pioneerrise.com.au
This fabulous new sub-division only just now released offers families an opportunity to buy a lovely block in the fast growing suburb of Strathfieldsaye. A great family community where people enjoy living and take advantage all that Strathfieldsaye has to offer as well as being only minutes to the Bendigo CBD.
Note: The Status report online shows blocks as available. You need to call Gavin on 0427 887 766 to ask which blocks remain available.
This information has been provided to us by third parties and we do not accept any responsibility for its accuracy. You should make your own enquiries and check the information so as to determine whether or not this information is in fact accurate. You must make your own assessment and obtain professional advice if necessary.

Description:
LIKE NEW, THE PERFECT LIFESTYLE PROPERTY
Ideally positioned, just five minutes drive to the CBD yet backing on to Bendigo Bushland Trail and one block from Spring Gully General Store, bus stop, and Spring Gully Sporting Reserve, is this contemporary and luxurious family home. Sitting on a fully landscaped, spacious allotment, this stunning home is like new and ready to be enjoyed.
Elevated, at the top of a quiet court, the custom-built property offers a grand entrance with 3m high ceilings in the entry hall leading to a light-filled formal lounge. Beyond the lounge is a practical study nook and a small hallway leads down to the master suite. Along with a walk-in robe, this room features a spacious ensuite with quality fittings. Steps lead up from the entry to an open plan kitchen, living and dining room. The dual aspect space is light and bright, and the kitchen includes stone benchtops, black tapware and a butlers pantry.
Off the main living is a hallway leading down to three additional bedrooms, all with built-in robes. This section of the home also includes a large laundry with side access; a family bathroom with freestanding bathtub; separate toilet with powder room; and a kids lounge area. One of the bedrooms offers ensuite-style access to the family bathroom.
Sliding doors from both the main living area and the kids lounge open out to an exposed aggregate alfresco space with ceiling fan, lights and power. This fantastic entertaining zone overlooks the huge back lawn, with plenty of space for a shed, pool, playset or all three! Side access allows extra off-street parking for a trailer, caravan, boat or extra vehicles.
Additional features include:
Commercial grade refrigerative ducted air conditioning and ducted heating (thermostat controlled)
Ceiling fans in all bedrooms
Modern, quality kitchen appliances including 900mm stove with five-burner gas cooktop and dishwasher
Ample storage throughout
Secure access from garage into home
Double gates at side of home for secure vehicle access to rear yard
Storage container shed
With not a thing to do, yet still providing ample scope to truly make the home your own, this is a rare opportunity to enjoy modern family living in an exclusive, family-friendly area. This property is perfect for the buyer who is looking for luxury, style and quality just minutes from both the CBD and bushland tracks.
Insights: 6 Pendlebury court, Spring Gully VIC 3550 was last sold in 2020 and 10 other 4 bedroom house in Spring Gully have recently been sold.

Description:
Loved Family Home
In the ever popular Strathdale area, this much-loved family home has never been revealed to the Bendigo market. This outstanding example of a loved and cared for 1965-built home is incredible and a credit to its owner. This immaculate property offers:
Corner allotment location, weatherboard construction with established front and rear gardens
Spacious front living area, three bedrooms all with ceiling fans, two with built-in robes
Modern wheelchair-accessible bathroom with large shower, toilet and suspended vanity
Second bathroom with shower, bath and hand basin plus a separate toilet
Kitchen with gas cooktop and oven, freestanding dishwasher, cupboards and bench space
Dining area off the kitchen and second living zone
Ducted reverse cycle heating and cooling unit, plus additional heating and cooling options
Automatic roller blinds on the outside of the front windows for additional privacy and weather protection
Spacious backyard with side access and off-street parking, a double-parking bay for further car/trailer/caravan or alike
3m x 3m garden shed, fernery area, pergola with concrete base overlooking the private and peaceful backyard
Two bus stops right outside your door
This is a prime example of a solid home, whether it's for raising a family, adding to an investment portfolio or retiring in. Be very quick to book your private inspection with the Heard & Co. Sales Team today.

Description:
Four Bedrooms and a Big Shed on a Large Block
Well-planned and well-loved, is this well-presented family home with large shed.
Featuring four bedrooms, with robes in three, and a walk-in robe as well as built-in robes in the main, which also has an ensuite.
The two spacious living areas include a formal lounge at the front, and a family/dining room at the back in an open-plan environment, which leads outside onto a large undercover BBQ/alfresco area, with ceiling fans and aggregate floor.
The kitchen is well-planned and appointed, having a walk-in pantry, plenty of bench space, cupboard storage, dishwasher and new 900mm stand-alone gas stove.
Big commercial heating and cooling split system, plus gas and solar hot water.
Outside is a double garage with direct access to the home and access to the backyard. There is separate side access to the shed for the caravan or trailer.
The shed is 6m x 10m in size with power, concrete floor and storage room.
There is also a fenced-off vegie garden area.
Located in a very popular area, this fantastic home is sited on a large block, with all the features to make a family very comfortable.
A popular hot-spot location within walking distance to public transport, walking tracks and parkland.
A must to inspect!

Description:
CONTEMPORARY FAMILY HOME WITH FANTASTIC GARDEN
Located in the heart of the community of Axedale, this contemporary home is within walking distance of primary school, golf course, pub, store and the Campaspe River. An easy drive to Lake Eppalock, the property is also less than 20 minutes to Bendigo. Sitting on two acres (approx.) of fully landscaped level land, this property offers country living in a modern build near all amenities.
Set back from the road, a wide circular driveway provides easy vehicle access to both the double garage and the side driveway that allows entry to the rear yard. The front door opens into a large, light hallway and to one side is a spacious master with walk-in robe and ensuite with double vanity and separate toilet. Further down the hallway is a second bedroom with built-in robe, and the remaining two bedrooms are located in a separate wing off the main living area. This section of the home also includes a huge family bathroom with double vanity; full powder room; and linen closet.
A formal lounge towards the front of the home features built-in surround sound, making it the perfect theatre room. At the rear of the house is a sizeable open plan kitchen, living and dining room. A huge walk-in pantry offers built-in coffee machine and microwave, and quality appliances, stone benchtops and ample storage create a user-friendly space. A large laundry off the kitchen opens out to the side of the house.
The side yard is fully fenced, and accessible via the laundry and formal lounge, making it a fantastic space for kids or dogs. Glass sliding doors from the main living area lead out to an alfresco space with ceiling fan, lights and power and this overlooks a gravel courtyard with the expansive yard beyond. A shed, greenhouse, polytunnel and orchard make for a green thumbs dream and there is an abundance of established fruit trees including apricot, peach, apple, fig, cherry, nectarine and more.
Additional features include:
Split system heating and cooling throughout
Solid fuel heater in main living
Quality Blanco kitchen appliances including four-burner gas cooktop, 900mm oven, dishwasher, microwave and coffee machine
Steel frame
Double glazing on all windows on the east of house
Oversized double garage (7.2 x 6.5m)
Shed at rear (12m x 6m)
2 x water tanks (45,000l total capacity)
Greenhouse, polytunnel and covered orchard
A fabulous lifestyle property encouraging outdoor living and being a part of a great community, this home is ideal for a family looking for the good life, or perhaps a downsizer moving from a rural locale and still seeking a quality home and a patch of land in a quiet, regional area.
